alert.note: Alert for Northern Foot Hills (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 24 at 1:36PM MST until January 25 at 11:00PM MST by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...LONG DURATION SNOWFALL EVENT BEGINS TONIGHT... .Several days of on and off snowfall are expected over the remainder of the week, particularly over portions of the northern South Dakota Black Hills and Wyoming Black Hills. The first round of moderate to heavy snow will begin tonight, with upslope enhanced snow anticipated late tonight through tomorrow over higher elevations of the northern Black Hills. A broader area of light to moderate snow will likely occur across the northeastern Wyoming plains and northern foothills, which, combined with gusty northwest winds tonight and tomorrow, will lead to difficult travel conditions. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 PM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...The Northern Foot Hills. * WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 11 PM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A break in snowfall is expected late Wednesday night into early Thursday. However, additional rounds of snow are expected later in the week.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Road conditions are available on your smartphone from the 5 1 1 app for your state.
